courses.Course number & title: Project-Based Learning in Liberal Arts and Engineering Studies
courses.Course description: Examination of how to define LAES as a new field of study; analysis of the creative process and team building in theory and in application.  Researching, writing, revising and presenting a technical proposal suitable for submission to a national design competition seeking innovative solutions to complex technological/social problems.  2 seminars, 2 activities.

courses.Course number & title: Advanced Project-Based Learning in Liberal Arts and Engineering Studies
courses.Course description: Teamwork and leadership in project-based learning.  Students lead, build, and maintain project teams; guide the creative process; and use and evaluate the principles of project management in theory and practice.  Development of a technical proposal suitable for submission to a national design competition seeking innovative solutions to complex technological/social problems.  2 seminars, 2 activities.

courses.Course number & title: Global Synthesis in Liberal Arts and Engineering Studies
courses.Course description: Onsite work with a global technical development and/or design team to develop a project to be completed/expanded upon in LAES461.  Through guided online discussion with the instructor and fellow LAES students, work through intercultural collaboration and design issues, and present works-in-progress.  4 lectures.

courses.Course number & title: Senior Project in Liberal Arts and Engineering Studies
courses.Term: Term Typically Offered: F, W, SP
courses.Course description: Under faculty supervision, the selection and completion of a senior project, demonstrating an interdisciplinary focus in LAES.  With one-on-one format with the instructor, individual or small group work through many iterations of the senior project, with occasional showing of works in small student groups.

courses.Course number & title: Capstone Senior Seminar in Liberal Arts and Engineering Studies
courses.Term: Term Typically Offered: F, W, SP
courses.Course description: The final refinement and completion of LAES senior projects and other projects.  In a development workshop format, presentation of final versions of works-in-progress to combined faculty and professional review committees throughout the quarter.
